data.title: Top Clubs in Ibiza
data.meta_description: Discover the best clubs in Ibiza featuring the biggest and best international DJs. Enjoy world-class DJs and live acts in the islands hottest nightclubs and day clubs.
data.text:
Ibiza is an island in the Mediterranean Sea and has been a party hotspot for decades. Clubs in Ibiza offer a vibrant nightlife scene that ranges from high-end super clubs to beachfront cocktail bars. You can find a wide range of music playing in these clubs, ranging from house to tech-house, techno, EDM and more. So whether you’re looking for an EDM rave or a more chill dance session, you can find amazing clubs in Ibiza that will satisfy your nightlife desires. If you’re looking for wild nights with incredible music, then Ibiza is the place to be!

Ibiza is the home to dozens of high-end nightclubs and day clubs boasting world-renowned DJs and innovative sound systems. The summer season between May and October creates the perfect atmosphere for partying, with a massive selection of music, events, and parties for all types of party people.

Notable clubs in Ibiza include Amnesia, Hi Ibiza, Ushuaia, Pacha, Eden, Es Paradís, DC10, and more. You’ll find something to suit all tastes across these venues, whether you want mainstream house beats or underground techno sounds. They range from glamorous super clubs offering stunning pool parties and spectacular entertainment to concept bars playing all types of electronic music. Whatever your idea of an unforgettable evening out might be, you won’t regret visiting Ibiza for a night out!

The dress code for clubs in Ibiza can vary depending on the specific club and the event taking place. However, in general, the dress code in Ibiza clubs is smart casual, which can mean anything from jeans, shorts, shirts and dresses.

Please note you will be denied entry if you are wearing a football shirt or swimwear. Also you need to be fully clothed when entering the clubs, this includes day pool parties like O Beach and Ibiza Rocks. Make sure you have a shirt on when entering these venues, even if you intend on taking it off straight afterwards.

If you have a VIP table at Pacha, Ushuaia or Hi Ibiza then remember to dress smart as these can be a bit more strict on the wear.

We highly recommend on wearing comfortable shoes in the clubs. Remember that these venues are open for 6-8 hours so if intend on spending most of the time dancing then that’s a lot of time on your feet, so above all wear shoes that you will feel comfortable in!

Some venues provide storage for clothes and bags, so make sure to have something warm after the parties as it may get cold. This really applies to near the start and end of the season so May and end of September and October when the weather is a bit cooler during the mornings and evenings. You don’t need to worry about this in peak summer months in June, July and August as the days and nights during these months are as hot as the days. If you intent to use the clubs lockers, then check beforehand if the venue provides this facility.

Club entry prices in Ibiza can vary widely depending on several factors, including the month of year, the specific club, the event or DJ performing, and even the time you arrive. Ibiza is renowned for its vibrant nightlife scene, and it offers a wide range of clubbing experiences to cater to different budgets and preferences.

During the peak summer season, which typically runs from June to September, entry prices to some of the island’s famous super clubs are at their highest. Expect to pay anywhere from 40 euros to 100 euros for entry, especially for big-name DJs and popular events such as Calvin Harris, David Guetta, Music On or Elrow. These high-profile clubs often offer immersive experiences with top-tier production and renowned talent, making them worth the investment for many partygoers. The same events can cost a little less in more quiet months such as May or end of September / beginning of October.

To get the best value for your money, consider checking our party calendar for event listings and pricing information in advance. Many clubs offer early bird tickets if you buy a couple of months before the event or discounts before 1am (for entering the club).

Keep in mind that Ibiza’s clubbing culture is not just about the entry fee; it’s about the entire experience. You can often find themed parties, unique venues, and diverse music styles to suit your tastes. Whether you’re looking for a glamorous night at a famous super club or a more intimate and budget-friendly affair, Ibiza has something for every party enthusiast.

Club opening hours in Ibiza can vary depending on the specific club and event. Here are some general guidelines for club opening times in Ibiza –

During the season which is from end of April to mid October, most of the nightclubs open from 11:00 PM and 12:00 AM (midnight) and stay open until 6:00 AM or 6:30 AM.

The Opening Parties are held from end of April and carry on throughout whole of May and even some in June and July. Here we are talking about parties or events in a nightclub, and not the clubs itself. The actual Opening Parties of the venues take place in April and May, and all of the venues in Ibiza are open by May.

We already covered what time the clubs in Ibiza close, but what about when the clubs close officially?

Some of the Closing Parties parties take place as early as August, for example Calvin Harris. However the official club Closing Parties take place in the month of October.

During the winter off-season, most of the clubs in Ibiza close entirely or have significantly reduced operating hours. Some venues may host occasional events, especially around holidays or special occasions, such as New Years Eve and New Years Day. Some of the clubs that host such events are Pacha, Amnesia and Akasha.
